'''0.0.19a_06'''<ref name="blog image">https://web.archive.org/web/20140427005742/https://notch.tumblr.com/image/127131555</ref><ref>https://youtu.be/HLMzpC0PDQA</ref> is a version of [[Java Edition Classic]] released on June 20, 2009, at 01:32 UTC,<ref name="irc">[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P8:29:33 <Rroff> when I have the game running the system timer goes nuts''" [...] "''P8:32:12 <Notch> Rroff, Zurik: Does it work better now?''", "''P8:32:22 <Notch> (client _06)''" (June 20, 2009, 01:32 UTC)</ref> to fix an issue with a glitched game timer.<ref name="changes">[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P8:38:56 <ZomBuster> what is new in 06?''" [...] "''P8:39:07 <Notch> not much, trying to fix a timing issue rrof has''"  (June 19, 2009, 01:38 to 01:39 UTC)</ref>

0.0.19a_06 was reuploaded at 01:37 UTC (five minutes after release) to again try to fix the glitched system timer; however, this did not work.<ref>[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P8:35:38 <Rroff> when I have the game running my system timer goes nuts''" [...] "''P8:37:37 <Notch> Rroff: Try now''" [...] "''P8:37:50 <Notch> version _06, I think I forgot to bump the number''" [...] "''P8:38:53 <Rroff> nope sorry still going nuts''" [...] "''P8:41:42 <Notch> whoa, it's breaking your timer :-O''" [...] "''P8:42:11 <Notch> Rroff: I'll look into it more tomorrow''" (June 19, 2009, 01:35 to 01:42 UTC)</ref>

== Fixes ==
* Tried to fix the glitched system timer from the previous version.<ref name="irc"/><ref name="changes"/>
** Worked for one user<ref>[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P8:33:16 <Zuriki> Fixed my clock Notch ^-^''" (June 20, 2009, 01:33:16 UTC)</ref> but not another.<ref>[[#logs|IRC logs]]: "''P8:34:35 <Notch> Rroff: Any luck? =)''", "''P8:34:38 <Rroff> nope sorry''" (June 20, 2009, 01:34 UTC)</ref>
